block.p: This summer, the metal of the moment is neither gold nor silver, but an alloy of the two. The lustrous tone, simultaneously warm and cool, can take on the hue of one or the other metal depending on how light hits the surface. Lambertson Truex's Finley clutch, right, is overlaid with a pixilated silver foil, imparting a shimmery look ($1,490 by special order at Lambertson Truex in Los Angeles, 323-951-9622). Manolo Blahnik describes the color of its strappy high-heeled Tunica sandals, right, as ''alba,'' the Italian word for dawn ($565 at Jeffrey New York, 212-206-1272), while Dolce & Gabbana's thong sandals are called ''platino'' ($495 at Dolce & Gabbana stores; call 212-249-4100 to order). Stella McCartney's ''metallic'' silk and polyester shift pops like a lightning bolt in a heat storm ($1,530 at Intermix stores). What to call this melded color? ''Gilver'' is one suggestion, though retailers would surely prefer ''sold.''
